query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
1 Poi fummo dentro al soglio de la porta 2 che ’l mal amor de l’anime disusa, 3 perché fa parer dritta la via torta,
4 sonando la senti’ esser richiusa; 5 e s’io avesse li occhi vòlti ad essa, 6 qual fora stata al fallo degna scusa?
7 Noi salavam per una pietra fessa, 8 che si moveva e d’una e d’altra parte, 9 sì come l’onda che fugge e s’appressa.
query.result:
1 Then we were inside the threshold of the gate 2 that the evil love of the souls disuses, 3 because it makes the crooked path seem straight,
4 I heard it being closed by sounding; 5 and if I had turned my eyes to it, 6 what excuse would have been worthy for the fault?
7 We climbed up a cracked stone, 8 that moved on one side and the other, 9 like the wave that flees and approaches.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
10 «Qui si conviene usare un poco d’arte», 11 cominciò ’l duca mio, «in accostarsi 12 or quinci, or quindi al lato che si parte».
query.result: 10 "Here it is necessary to use a little bit of skill", 11 my leader began, "in getting close 12 now on this side, now on that side to the edge that moves away".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
13 E questo fece i nostri passi scarsi, 14 tanto che pria lo scemo de la luna 15 rigiunse al letto suo per ricorcarsi,
16 che noi fossimo fuor di quella cruna; 17 ma quando fummo liberi e aperti 18 sù dove il monte in dietro si rauna,
19 ïo stancato e amendue incerti 20 di nostra via, restammo in su un piano 21 solingo più che strade per diserti.
query.result:
13 And this made our steps scarce, 14 so much that the waning moon 15 reached its bed to lie down again before
16 we were out of that needle's eye; 17 but when we were free and out in the open 18 up where the mountain gathers back together,
19 I, tired, and both uncertain 20 of our way, we stopped on a plain 21 more solitary than roads through deserts.

22 From its edge, where the void ends, 23 to the foot of the high bank that still rises, 24 a human body would measure it in three steps;
25 and as far as my eye could stretch its wings, 26 now on the left and now on the right side, 27 this ledge seemed to me to be like that.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
28 Là sù non eran mossi i piè nostri anco, 29 quand’ io conobbi quella ripa intorno 30 che dritto di salita aveva manco,
31 esser di marmo candido e addorno 32 d’intagli sì, che non pur Policleto, 33 ma la natura lì avrebbe scorno.
query.result:
28 Our feet had not yet moved up there, 29 when I recognized that bank all around, 30 which lacked a direct path to climb,
31 to be of white marble and adorned 32 with such carvings that not only Polykleitos, 33 but Nature herself would have been put to shame there.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
34 L’angel che venne in terra col decreto 35 de la molt’ anni lagrimata pace, 36 ch’aperse il ciel del suo lungo divieto,
37 dinanzi a noi pareva sì verace 38 quivi intagliato in un atto soave, 39 che non sembiava imagine che tace.
query.result:
34 The angel who came to Earth with the decree 35 of the peace wept for many years, 36 who opened Heaven from its long interdict,
37 seemed so lifelike before us 38 carved there in a gentle pose, 39 that it did not seem like an image that is silent.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
46 «Non tener pur ad un loco la mente», 47 disse ’l dolce maestro, che m’avea 48 da quella parte onde ’l cuore ha la gente.
query.result: 46 "Do not keep your mind fixed on just one place", 47 said the gentle master, who was on that side of me where people have their heart.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
49 Per ch’i’ mi mossi col viso, e vedea 50 di retro da Maria, da quella costa 51 onde m’era colui che mi movea,
52 un’altra storia ne la roccia imposta; 53 per ch’io varcai Virgilio, e fe’mi presso, 54 acciò che fosse a li occhi miei disposta.
query.result:
49 So I turned my face and saw 50 behind Mary, on that side 51 where the one who was moving me was,
52 another story carved into the rock; 53 so I stepped past Virgil and drew near, 54 so that it would be laid out before my eyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
55 Era intagliato lì nel marmo stesso 56 lo carro e ’ buoi, traendo l’arca santa, 57 per che si teme officio non commesso.
query.result: 55 There was carved there in the marble itself 56 the cart and the oxen, drawing the holy ark, 57 for which reason one fears an unauthorized task.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
58 Dinanzi parea gente; e tutta quanta, 59 partita in sette cori, a’ due mie’ sensi 60 faceva dir l’un ‘No’, l’altro ‘Sì, canta’.
query.result: 58 In front there seemed to be people; and all of them, 59 divided into seven choirs, made 60 one of my senses say 'No', the other 'Yes, they are singing'.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
61 Similemente al fummo de li ’ncensi 62 che v’era imaginato, li occhi e ’l naso 63 e al sì e al no discordi fensi.
query.result: 61 Similarly to the smoke of the incense 62 that was depicted there, my eyes and nose 63 disagreed with both the yes and the no.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
64 Lì precedeva al benedetto vaso, 65 trescando alzato, l’umile salmista, 66 e più e men che re era in quel caso.
query.result: 64 There, dancing and uplifted, the humble psalmist 65 preceded the blessed vessel, 66 and in that situation he was more and less than a king.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
67 Di contra, effigïata ad una vista 68 d’un gran palazzo, Micòl ammirava 69 sì come donna dispettosa e trista.
query.result: 67 Opposite, depicted in a scene 68 of a grand palace, Michal was looking on in wonder, 69 like a disdainful and sad woman.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
70 I’ mossi i piè del loco dov’ io stava, 71 per avvisar da presso un’altra istoria, 72 che di dietro a Micòl mi biancheggiava.
query.result: 70 I moved my feet from the place where I was standing, 71 to examine up close another story, 72 that was gleaming white behind Michal.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
79 Intorno a lui parea calcato e pieno 80 di cavalieri, e l’aguglie ne l’oro 81 sovr’ essi in vista al vento si movieno.
query.result: 79 Around him there seemed to be a dense and full 80 throng of knights, and the eagles in gold 81 above them seemed to move in the wind.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
94 Colui che mai non vide cosa nova 95 produsse esto visibile parlare, 96 novello a noi perché qui non si trova.
query.result: 94 He who never saw anything new 95 produced this visible speech, 96 new to us because it is not found here.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
97 Mentr’ io mi dilettava di guardare 98 l’imagini di tante umilitadi, 99 e per lo fabbro loro a veder care,
100 «Ecco di qua, ma fanno i passi radi», 101 mormorava il poeta, «molte genti: 102 questi ne ’nvïeranno a li alti gradi».
query.result:
97 While I was delighting in gazing at 98 the images of so much humility, 99 and finding them dear because of their maker,
100 "Look over here, but they are taking slow steps", 101 the poet was murmuring, "many people: 102 these will direct us to the high steps".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
103 Li occhi miei, ch’a mirare eran contenti 104 per veder novitadi ond’ e’ son vaghi, 105 volgendosi ver’ lui non furon lenti.
query.result: 103 My eyes, which were content to gaze 104 in order to see new things for which they have a longing, 105 were not slow in turning towards him.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
106 Non vo’ però, lettor, che tu ti smaghi 107 di buon proponimento per udire 108 come Dio vuol che ’l debito si paghi.
query.result: 106 However, reader, I do not want you to be dismayed 107 from a good intention upon hearing 108 how God wants the debt to be paid.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
109 Non attender la forma del martìre: 110 pensa la succession; pensa ch’al peggio 111 oltre la gran sentenza non può ire.
query.result: 109 Do not dwell on the form of the martyrdom: 110 think of the succession; think that the worst 111 cannot go beyond the great judgment.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
112 Io cominciai: «Maestro, quel ch’io veggio 113 muovere a noi, non mi sembian persone, 114 e non so che, sì nel veder vaneggio».
query.result: 112 I began: "Master, those that I see 113 moving towards us do not seem like people to me, 114 and I do not know what, so I am deluded in seeing them".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
115 Ed elli a me: «La grave condizione 116 di lor tormento a terra li rannicchia, 117 sì che ’ miei occhi pria n’ebber tencione.
query.result: 115 And he to me: "The grievous condition 116 of their torment makes them crouch to the ground, 117 so that my eyes contended with them at first.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
118 Ma guarda fiso là, e disviticchia 119 col viso quel che vien sotto a quei sassi: 120 già scorger puoi come ciascun si picchia».
query.result: 118 But look closely there, and disentangle 119 with your sight what is coming under those rocks: 120 you can already make out how each one is beating himself".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
121 O superbi cristian, miseri lassi, 122 che, de la vista de la mente infermi, 123 fidanza avete ne’ retrosi passi,
124 non v’accorgete voi che noi siam vermi 125 nati a formar l’angelica farfalla, 126 che vola a la giustizia sanza schermi?
127 Di che l’animo vostro in alto galla, 128 poi siete quasi antomata in difetto, 129 sì come vermo in cui formazion falla?
130 Come per sostentar solaio o tetto, 131 per mensola talvolta una figura 132 si vede giugner le ginocchia al petto,
133 la qual fa del non ver vera rancura 134 nascere ’n chi la vede; così fatti 135 vid’ io color, quando puosi ben cura.
query.result:
121 O proud Christians, miserable wretches, 122 who, sick in the sight of your mind, 123 have trust in backward steps,
124 do you not realize that we are worms 125 born to form the angelic butterfly, 126 that flies to justice without barriers?
127 Why does your soul float on high, 128 when you are almost like defective automatons, 129 like a worm in which formation fails?
130 As to support a ceiling or a roof, 131 sometimes a figure is seen as a console 132 joining its knees to its chest,
133 which makes a true resentment of the unreal 134 arise in those who see it; thus made 135 I saw those, when I paid close attention.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
136 Vero è che più e meno eran contratti 137 secondo ch’avien più e meno a dosso; 138 e qual più pazïenza avea ne li atti,
139 piangendo parea dicer: ‘Più non posso’.
query.result:
136 It is true that they were more and less hunched over 137 according to how much or little they had on their backs; 138 and whoever had more patience in his actions,
139 seemed to be saying with his weeping: 'I can't take it anymore'.
